cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 mi E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally west, then west-southwest, toward the south-central Texas coast with inland motion over northern Mexico by day-3
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the south Texas coast near Corpus Christi (between Baffin Bay and Mesquite Bay)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Louisiana; watches confined to south Texas coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Baffin Bay–Sargent TX; Hurricane Warning Baffin Bay–Mesquite Bay TX; Tropical-Storm Warning Mouth of Rio Grande–Baffin Bay and Mesquite Bay–San Luis Pass TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along the south Texas shoreline, with secondary effects (rain, rip currents) extending to the upper Texas and Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds possible, but sustained gales unlikely at the port (≤4 % chance of 34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: No appreciable surge expected this far inland on the Mississippi River
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain possible Sat-Sun with locally higher totals, producing a flash-flood threat around terminal facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes possible across southeast Louisiana; hazardous surf and rip currents along the Louisiana coastline
